Reviews.Title: “Basic, but real attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: mattfromlancs
Reviews.Content: Bear in mind that this is a 1* hotel in Italy, and in a very expensive city. Don't expect to get anywhere near what you would at these prices elsewhere. This hotel doesn't do much but does it well. Positives: + Very clean. + Nicely decorated and kept. + Very good service. + Good size rooms for a one star Venice. + Excellent location in San Marco. + 24hr reception and free wifi. Negatives: - Not cheap for these facilities even in Venice, but the above advantages make it reasonable value. - Basic rooms, not a problem for us but the lack of air con would be an issue in summer and some people just need more gubbins. - Not much by way of facilities. - The biggest problem: hot water wasn't consistent, the shower ran intermittently cold and one morning there was no hot at all, but again it was manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Basic, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LoganSquareNeighbor
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at this hotel for a recent trip to Venice. We choose a triple room with en suite; the room and bath were immaculate. The staff was very friendly. This accommodation is basic and a good value. We loved the location, which is close to a great campo--San Stefano. It's an easy walk to San Marco, the Rialto, or Academia. The hotel is also steps away from a traghetto crossing which makes a quick walk to the train station. We recommend it as a good choice for the thrifty traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short break in Venince”
Reviews.Author: RoryAndHelen
Reviews.Content: Well maintained and modestly priced (for Venice!) hotel. The room was quite small but very clean and the en-suite was new. The double bed was very comfy and the shower was poweful. No TV which we didn't miss and no hair-dryer which would have been useful. If we were staying for more than 3 nights then I would have preferred a slightly larger room. Location was convenient for the Water Bus and was close to, but not in the middle of, the San Marco and Rialtto very busy areas. No breakfast at this hotel but it is offered at a sister hotel for 5 Euros about 10 mins walk away including as 50 cent gondola ride across the Grand Canal. We had breakfast once, on our last day, as it seem quite far away but it is very convenient on the way to the Bus station for the trip back to the airport. Given the price of breakfast elsewhere we should probably have taken them up on this more often! (on a side note the restaurant where breakfast is served was very nice and the menu looked very good!) Should note that the hotel is accessed off the street through a small courtyard which has a drain in it that did smell a little bit. All in all a good stay. Venice is amazing and very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “1 star hotel ranks 5 hearts with us!”
Reviews.Author: Hairbrained
Reviews.Content: San Samuele is a rare and true gem in the heart of Venice! Initially I was drawn to the detailed directions from the airport. Then I couldn't help but be attracted to the price. But what sold me on this place was the people that were so gracious and welcoming.I started following this Albergo on facebook, before my stay. This made me feel even more connected to the people, and Venice. I also checked out the street on Veniceconnected.it I was able to survey up and down the surrounding streets (as Safety is somewhat of an issue to me). You will certainly appreciate the impeccable standards to which the room was cleaned each day.The room size was plenty big enough for my daughter and myself. We had our own private bathroom and shower, and I particularly enjoyed the shower being on a sort of sliding bar(I'm rather short, and this is the first hotel ever where I could have the spray at a comfortable level). I agree with countless others that this charming hotel is in a prime spot for all the "must see" places. I also loved it's situation in the arts district.According to one of the staff, this entire building, at one time was one dwelling and was on somewhat of a grand level. My description of our room could be that of tasteful, and slightly understated decor. You won't find over-the-top opulence here, but you will find a wonderfully safe clean and inexpensive haven in Venice, and use the money you save on the city! This is the only place for us in Venice. Thank-you San Samuele you were a big part of our fond memories of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quiet hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jackie B
Reviews.Content: I shall certainly stay at San Samuele again. The location is great, the room my daughter and I had was fine and - very important in my book, but rarely easy to find - the situation is quiet. No television coming through the walls from neighbouring rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, a little library of books about Venice, ease of access at all hours - and wi fi. The hotel was recommended to me and I'd certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions deceptive”
Reviews.Author: Waddles54
Reviews.Content: The first impression of this hotel was deceptive. After walking through a dingy courtyard, and up some well worn stairs, we emerged into a dull reception area. However, our room on the first floor was large by any standards, and we had a fabulous newly renovated bathroom, which would have put many highter rated hotels to shame. Service was efficient and friendly. The hotel has some limitations, the room could be warm during summer with no airconditioning, and there is no tv or coffee making facilities, however as one previous review has noted, why would you want one in Venice? The room itself was in need of some minor maintenance, but overall we found it great. The area around the hotel has some great eating places, and is just far enough away from the bustle of Venice to provide a welcome relief at the end of the day. Very happy to recommend to other travellers, provided you are not expecting 5 star accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Jason R
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in the off season. Room was large and had a nice view of the main street. Bathroom was clean. The place is open 24 hours so no problem staying out late. Check in was simple. Rooms are basic and the price is excellent. No TV but what do you need one for in Venice! Check out was just as simple. Location is really central for main tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to save some money and paid the price”
Reviews.Author: munshado
Reviews.Content: From the pictures and the reviews I would think that I didn't even stay at the right place. This place was weird and kind of run down, except the shared bathroom which was nice and newer. I had reserved a room with a double bed. I know in Italy that is often 2 twin together...but we had a twin bed and a cot next to it that was 8 inches lower. The room looked okay at first sight but then upon further inspection my husband saw seman stains on the wall and wouldn't have been surprised to see a rat. He is average size and sat on the cot and it collapsed due to metal fatigue. The bath mats looked like small tablecloths, very thin and strange. We left and found a better hotel right by Rialto bridge. Maybe we just got the crap room but the furniture in the shared areas was covered with white sheets and til all looked run down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for such a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: jasperchen
Reviews.Content: I would second all of devourk's comments about San Samuele. We stayed in a smaller room but we were still perfectly comfortable. The room was very clean and well maintained and the staff were extremely helpful and prompt. The hotel is in a great location and manages to retain a quaint Venetian charm without being run down. A good choice for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our cozy little retreat”
Reviews.Author: devourk
Reviews.Content: The location rocked !!!! we arrived by train and took the no. 2 waterboat to San Samuele. Once we got off the waterboat the B+B was only a min walk. No bridges - so that helped us out perfectly with our big bags. Check in process was very quick and we were given keys to our room number 9 - which was the best room we had in the entire trip. It felt like our private little apartment as it was on a floor of its own and we were locked away :) loved it. Clean sheets, comfy bed and renovated toilets. Shower pressure was excellent too. We will definitely be back. The B+B was a 15 minute walk from San Marco square, but there are a ton of restaurants and gorgeous little art galleries with minutes of the B+B. For dinner, i would suggest going accross the bridge to Ca' Rezzanico - the restaurants there were phenomenal and not as expensive as Piazza de San Stefano. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for the Money”
Reviews.Author: adventure97701
Reviews.Content: Rick Steves said this was a "backpacker's dump". I don't think that was a fair evaluation. They do keep the place clean and it is nicely located in Venice. Not a new lavish place by any means, but we needed a clean place to sleep and that's what it is. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katarzyna U
Reviews.Content: A very nice small hotel, "Venecian style", probably one of the best in this price category in Venice. Clean and cosy, very good location (easily reachable by foot from the main touristic sites and public means). We were a bit afraid what to expect from a 1star hotel, but I guess 1 star was granted due to a small size, no lifts and no breakfast. Room was very cosy, bathroom new and clean. We would definately recommend a stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Fits my needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: echensf
Reviews.Content: I am a 41 single male, travels usually alone or with one friend and what I desire in a hotel is that it is clean, it functions efficiently and is no nonsense. I just need a place to put my head at night. Central location is also quite important, because if I am in a place, I really am not interested in spending time getting to and from places. This albergo (been here twice now and got one of the rooms that shares a bathroom) is exactly what I need. The shared bathroom situation might scare some off, but it is always cleaned, after every shower. I have never walked in where I am put off. The staff is discreet and keep things clean and tidy without really being seen. It makes me feel comfortable being here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: OttawaJack
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent two days and one night in Venice before taking a cruise in mid-September. We wanted to stay somewhere inexpensive but within walking distance of the main sights (Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge and Market). Venice can be very expensive during the high season and we were working within a short timeframe - - only two weeks before our departure. While searching, I just happened across a listing for Albergo San Samuele in the San Marco district. After checking a few references on TripAdvisor, we booked a triple room for a very reasonable $155 Euro. The hotel is easy to find - - the vaporetto stop (actually called San Samuele), is a short walk from the hotel. There also arenâ€™t any bridges along the way - - a blessing when youâ€™re hauling luggage. The hotel is small and it doesnâ€™t have a dining room so there is no breakfast included in the price but it is very close to cafÃ© bars and restaurants. Our room wasnâ€™t air conditioned but it did have a fan, very clean and modern bathroom and three fairly comfortable beds. Our room overlooked the main street but itâ€™s a very quiet residential area. The staff is friendly and courteous. If youâ€™re not in Venice during the dead of summer, I would definitely recommend this hotel as an inexpensive option. Something to note is that not all rooms have private baths.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it - but depends who you are”
Reviews.Author: marcopolo1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Samuele during a weekend trip to Venice. My wife and I did not agree on it. I found it charming and comfortable, she felt it took her back to her backpacking days. Venice is expensive, so the 120 euros a night we paid gets you much less of a hotel room than almost anywhere else in Italy. Here are the good things about the hotel that we agreed on: it's well located near a Vaporetto stop and in a charming neighorbood that's not overwhelmingly touristy but near the main sites. The staff are friendly and helpful. It's very clean. It's got free wi-fi. Here's what could be a problem but we didn't mind: it's a walk up (no elevator), and if you choose breakfast it's is in another location about 10 minutes walk away. We declined. There are minimarkets and real nice cafes right nearby where you'll enjoy yourself more than with a hotel breakfast. Here's what didn't bother me but bothered my wife: our room was small, the bed cover was synthetic and the wool blanket we asked didn't cover the bed, the bathroom is tiny and gets a bit wet with each shower. There is something I would warn about: there's no a/c and Venice can get awfully muggy in summer. We were there during a warm spell in early October and it was just manageable at night with windows open and the fan on, but August would have been painful. The hotel is on a very quiet street so having the window open wasn't a problem. All in all, it's a solid pleasant place, but it is a budget hotel, and being Venice the price doesn't feel very budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: William G
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with personality, in an outstanding location. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edmund51
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just off a pleasant square, very near two vaporetto stops covering different lines, and within easy walking distance of many sites. The room was of reasonable size and spotlessly clean, so it seemed very good value for the price, given that this was Venice. The desk staff and the cleaners couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. My wife and I have stayed at this hotel three times and certainly would again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: web2las
Reviews.Content: This hotel came to us with high recommendations. The location, near Piazza San Stefano, couldn't have been better. The room was large and the linens were clean and ironed, as one expects in Italy, but the bathroom, especially the very small shower, was substandard. Contemporary Italian design is excellent and the owners should consider upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not in summer!!!”
Reviews.Author: ozguntozacan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 2 nights in August. The location and room was ok but there is no air-condition. In the summer Venice is very very hot and extremely humid, I cannot sleep at first night. There is a fan but not enough. It is a value for money accomodation but if I visit Venice again I won't go in summer... If you visit Venice in summer look for A/C. Otherwise Albergo San Samuele is a nice place to stay in terms of location, room and cleanness.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to go again!”
Reviews.Author: Kamakiri1
Reviews.Content: Good points - Large and Clean room - Friendly hotel staff who speaks English! - Nice location close to Vapolett stop - Reasonable price Bad points - No elevator - Small shower space, no bathtub

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: shatch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and loved it! Albergo San Samuele is a funky old palace in a fantastic location. It was right down the street from a vaporetti, and a short 15 minute walk to San Marco's Square. It had a wonderfully helpful staff, free Internet and Wi-fi, clean and spacious rooms and bathrooms with lots of character. Besides feeling like we were staying in the Shining, we loved it! We highly recommend Albergo San Samuele.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VickyH2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet street only 10 minutes walk from St Marks Square and very near the water and water bus stops. The room was very basic but comfortable with an ensuite bathroom which had a good shower. The rooms are cleaned daily. The service was fantastic. The Manager spoke excellent English and was very helpful. The hotel had free internet access. I am a female and was travelling by myself but I felt very safe at the hotel. It was good value in an expensive city and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Smarty18
Reviews.Content: This little BnB is situated a 15min boat bus ride from the central railway station. From there it is very easy to find, as itâ€™s straight and up the street apx 150m. We found it with no hassles. It is a chintzy old BnB, which is more like a pension. It has been rated with only one star, which I feel is a bit unfair really. The staff are pleasant and they keep the place nice and tidy. We went for the double room with shared bathroom option, which was a good plan as it was cheaper and we got a nice corner room with two windows. The windows open out with double doors and little shutters, there is enough space to sit on the balcony ledge to get some sea breeze. The place is cute and quaint and has a nice feel to it. Venice is known for its elegant decay and this place is just that. We paid apx 65euro a night, which is excellent for Venice and itâ€™s in a good location too. We would definitely stay here again. We managed to find a little mini supermarket near by, where you can buy beautiful pesto, bread, cheese and salamis. All great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Real Venice”
Reviews.Author: ana_panic
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Samuele is lovely, very clean and pleasant hotel in central Venice. Stuff is great and everyone speeks English! Next to Palazzo Grassi (http://www.palazzograssi.it/) it is very close to boat station S. Samuele and 10 minutes by foot to everything. We had great time in this real Venetaian hotel with gold mirrors, painted walls and floor made of stone. I LOVE IT AND STRONGLY RECOMMENDED TO EVERYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor might be a little harsh, but it's definitely below average”
Reviews.Author: tourismento
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here during my short stay in Venice. The supposedly 1-star Hotel felt just like that of a 1-star Hotel and I have stayed in hostels which had better facilities and security than that of this hotel. If you're taking the train into Venice, do note this hotel is an approximate 2km walk from the rail station. Remember, it is Venice, there are numerous bridges to cross, and a swarm of tourist to maneuver through. Aside from the initial "adventurous" journey, accessibility to all other sites were okay (in Venice, the main means of transportation is by foot). During my stay, a unit opposite the Hotel was carrying out construction works, creating loud noises as early at 7 in the morning, just a warning to prepare for the unexpected whatever the reviews say, and wherever you decide to sleep at, as this is not within the Hotel's control. The room came with a sink and a mini closet. The room was a little small in my opinion, but I would classify it as decent considering how limited space is in Venice. There was Wifi in all room. Overall a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - which you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Ian2109
Reviews.Content: Venice is very expensive. That's how it is. So the 125 EUR / night we paid for a double room is probably at the lower end of the price spectrum, even if it doesn't seem like "budget" in the usual sense. The location is very good - in a typically charming Venetian lane just ten minutes walk from the Piazza San Marco and five minutes from a choice of two vaporetto stops. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was big, with two additional beds we didn't need but which might explain the price. It was all very spartan: no bathroom, not even a wash basin, no TV or radio and the room was in a poor state of decoration. There was, however, access to a very clean, modern bathroom down the corridor, to which we seemed to have sole use during our stay. The walls were thin and we were kept awake on two successive nights by two (different) groups of noisy neighbours. There is free WLAN - a big plus. There was no breakfast. The hotel offers a deal with a partner establishment which - for 5 EUR - seems a very good one but we didn't use it because it involves taking the ferry and a further 10-15 minutes walk. And it ends at 9:30. As an alternative you can walk around the corner to Campo Santo Stefano where you can get a panino and a cappuccino for about 8 EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CiaoCiaoBella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our second trip to Venice - the first trip we stayed at Mestre and really wanted to be in Venice itself this time. This hotel is lovely, very close to the San Samuele vaporetto stop and an easy walk to St Marks and Rialto. All the staff were very helpful, although not all spoke English. The room was a good size and clean with a window opening out onto a typical Venice streetscape. Breakfast at the Ribo cafe (which they have an arrangement with) is excellent and easy to find once you know how - but then again, getting lost is all part of the fun in Venice! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really helpful staff and brilliantly situated as well as cheap”
Reviews.Author: reusereusereuse
Reviews.Content: I was a bit uncertain about this hotel, having read mixed reviews on Trip Adviser, and because it was, for Venice, really, really, cheap. Also we are a vegetarian and a near vegan and I have been to Venice before and know how difficult it is to get decent veggie food. In fact, I was relieved and delighted. The place (do follow their instructions precisely to find it the first time from the Vaporetto!) is very old, very clean, very close to St. Marks, and other, beautiful squares, and very friendly. The staff were immensely helpful, suggesting bookshops, shoe shops, routes to places, cafe's that open really early, etc. etc. and really made the difference to our holiday. They even advised on finding a bar where we could watch a Tottenham/Arsenal game!! There is free internet access (on a fairly old pc) in the hallway. We had ensuite, which actually had enough shelf space! (pretty rare in many hotels) and was very quiet. I wondered, in fact, if the difference between the 'good' and 'poor' reviews might reflect the people who opted for a shared bathroom and those who paid extra for en suite. As far as food is concerned, there is a delicattessen on the corner of the street that sells vegan yoghourts and a wine merchant further up that street that was selling veggie organic wine. Because the place is so central, and so informal, and you get so tired walking around Venice, getting lost, etc. (!) we bought lots of bread, olives, etc. and either ate out in picnics, (or bought icecreams from an incredible place called Grom) or a few times [we had brought tea towels as "trays"] ate in our room. Also, there is an incredibly expensive, but nice, herbal perfumerie across the street, which appears to have vegetarian soaps, which smell incredible. We didn't take up the offer of a breakfast at a linked hotel on the other side of the Grand Canal, so I can't comment on that

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean, quiet, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: petermillman
Reviews.Content: We had an en suite room. I think some rooms aren't en suite, which could be a nuisance. But we found it fairly basic, but clean and quiet, and the staff were very patient and helpful with our numerous questions. And it's in a great central location, but nevertheless very quiet in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel is nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Stacy_Stefan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in September 2010. It is in a good location, close to San Marco and a water-bus stop. Accommodation is clean but very basic. Nothing special. We had a shared bathroom, which was clean and well appointed. You need to leave your key with the reception when you leave, which was fine. Reception staff not especially friendly. Room is on the larger side. It was very expensive â€“ 80 Euro for one night with a shared bathroom. However, this is not that unusual for Venice and we were glad of a clean hotel in a good location. It was fine, but probably wouldnâ€™t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Brian1244
Reviews.Content: We are a middle-aged Canadian couple who prefer to stay at safe, clean, modestly priced and well-located accommodations. The Albergo San Samuele is a great place to stay. The staff is both friendly and helpful. The room and separate bathroom are both clean and functional. This place is very well located - close to St. Marks square, the Accademia Bridge, restaurants and many of the popular sights. The vaparetto stop is nearby. We recommend this place and would definitely stay again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient in original Venetian building”
Reviews.Author: puzzlebruce
Reviews.Content: Our approach to visiting Venice was that we wanted to stay right in the middle of the action in Venice - which meant to be near Piazza San Marco. Albergo San Samuele fitted the bill perfectly. We stayed 3 nights. Only a few hundred metres from Piazza San Marco. Accommodation was basic but clean. Vintage of the building showed by the shortness of the door into our room - maybe 5 foot 11inches or thereabouts. Reception was about 2 flights up old worn stone stairs. This might be a discouragement for some, but for us it added to the experience. Quaint. And how many people had walked those stairs over hundreds of years before us. For Australians, this is an experience we cannot have in our own country. The music by the competing bands of musicians on the Friday night was magnificent. And then we saw a totally different side of Venice on the Sunday when it was raining & a bitter cold wind was blowing from the north. Slowing heavily on the Mountains around Venice and the the north. Parts of Piazza San Marco were knee deep in water. Winter had arrived early in Europe. Because of the long queues and opening hours, make sure you plan when you plan to enter the San Marc's Basilica, Palazzo Ducale or climb the tower (Campanile). Make sure you get to the fish & fruit markets just north of Rialto Bridge. Finding our way around Venice was far easier than we expected (eg just follow signs to San Marco, or Rialto bridge or the Accademia bridge or to the train station ... but it was handy to have Google maps on my GPS-equipped Android phone as a fall-back. In summary, Venice was a great experience - and staying at Albergo San Samuele enhanced that experience.

Reviews.Title: “No bells & whistles but good place to stay if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mspeyton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this "B&B" with my sister for one night in Venice. Was quite close to the San Samuele vaporetto stop (just need to keep an close eye out for the hotel signage). Room was not ready when we first arrived (was before check in time), but we were able to leave our luggage with the staff. Our room was up a few flights of stairs (no lift we were aware of). Room was basic - just a bed, a closet, & a fan - no TV, no A/C (was very warm in the middle of July!). We were only looking for a place to sleep though so the room was sufficient enough for our purposes. Shared bathroom/toilet - both were very clean. Breakfast was at a separate location that the hotel had a deal with and was a separate cost (approx. 8-10 euro)- we chose not to go with this option. Overall though was a decent place to stay for someone on a budget and isn't looking for any bells & whistles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great value”
Reviews.Author: Doc9076
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. San Marco, Accademia, Rialto all within 10 minute walk and hotel is on a quiet street. Quaint 450 yr old building, clean, nice sized rooms, and staff is super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but fun!”
Reviews.Author: lorimen
Reviews.Content: Old building that shows it's age. Beds weren't real comfotable, and the water pressure was real low. Lots of stairs, no lift. Location was great, and staff was very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet place, accomodation ok.”
Reviews.Author: Skyliteee
Reviews.Content: The people at the hotel were very nice and helpfull. The location wasnt exactly the hottest place but it was quiet. You could reach all interesting places within 10 minutes. The room was small with a bed and a small bathroom. Only problem were the thin walls. You could hear other people talking and walking. Besides that the place was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal - Nice staff, great location, room was adequate, free wifi”
Reviews.Author: siliwishes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a nice, fairly quiet street. My husband and I found the location to be excellent. We walked around the entire city over the course of two days and never took a vaporetto to return to the hotel. (You should take on from the train station with bags though.) It's like a 7 min walk to St. Mark's. The staff were very nice. They gave us the code for their free wifi, which was a very nice touch. They even gave us bug repellent things to plug in to the outlets when I inquired about whether there could be mosquitos if we opened the windows! (Bugs love me!) The room isn't super cozy, but not bad. No carpetting on the floor. The bed and pillows were a tad hard (but I have had worse) and the shower is the typical tiny European shower that tends to flood the bathroom when us Americans use it. But, it was a good deal overall. It was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and pleasant rooms with helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dandawson
Reviews.Content: This is close (not so close that you on top of it but not too far away..about ten min walk if u dont get lost) to saint marks square and the rialto bridge. In fact we were on a budget and only got the vapporetti once choosing to walk the rest of the time.Yes we got lost a couple of times but that was our fault and not the hotels and it was part of the fun as we found areas in venice we wouldn't normally have seen. Venice is very expensive so the 5 euro breakfast the hotel offers is very good value. Buffet style cereal, coffee, tea, orange juice (we had a few glasses) croissant,brioche, ham, preserves and some bread rolls. Overall considering the cost of the hotel compared to others in venice it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP BUT LOW QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: GREEKSTORYTELLER
Reviews.Content: Positive: cheap,heating all day,close to vaporeto stops Negative: small room-bath,bed in bad condition,no breakfast,try to be close to Venetian style but without success

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: lossenrogien
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Very quiet, great room and bathroom. Great location- we walked everywhere we could, and rarely used water buses. We only had two issues: 1 some of the staff does not speak english so I was forced to communicate in our only common language-spanish and 2. the breakfast situation was not fully explained to us when we arrived, so we did not understand that if you say that you are going to breakfast, you are expected to go to breakfast! Let me elaborate. The second morning of our stay we decided to try out the breakfast. The hotel does not offer its own breakfast, but offers a package where you can pay 50 cents to take a gondola ride to the island across the way, and then pay 5 euro for breakfast at a restaurant that the hotel has a relationship with. I was speaking to the staff member about breakfast in spanish, and I thought she said that she would call the restaurant to make sure that it was alright for 2 more people (my boyfriend and me) to go to breakfast. She called and the restaurant said it was fine. Twenty minutes later when we were actually leaving the hotel, she asked for us to pay her the 10 euro (5 each) that we owed for breakfast. We had decided that we didn't really have the time to go to this restaurant (it's a ten minute walk after you take the gondola ride, and we had a bit of a time crunch) so I apologized and said we were not going. The staff member then became very upset and angrily called the restaurant in front of us and complained that we had changed our minds and that we had inconvenienced all of them. This whole situation would have been avoided if we had been explained the breakfast situation upon our arrival at the hotel. Aside from this, our whole experience was positive.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful place and service”
Reviews.Author: JNGWorld
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, they went out of their way to ensure our comfort and convinience. The room was perfect,attic like with a big bed, cozy, super bathroom, immaculate, we loved it all..linen, decor and interior design Location is great..stone throw away from major points of interests..hard to get lost coz its marked by the piazza I liked best the service, the lovely room , the location, and affordability

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandTraveller123
Reviews.Content: Staff are most helpful, rooms are large and the hotel is situated close to St Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, cheap and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Kaydog920
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Just a couple minutes walking to all the tourist attractions! I recommend you get a map of Venice before arriving or trying to walk anywhere! The hotel room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. No A.C. but there was a big stand up fan which provided a good breeze at night. Bathroom was supplied with towels and soap. Room was very clean! Mosquitos are common during the summer months in Venice, so bring bug spray but the hotel will lend you some also. My friends did not have any issues with bug bites, but I did! I really liked this hotel and would definitly go back again. Its an excellent place to sleep at night especially if you are on a budget. Its very safe and would be family friendly! The staff was very nice!! Also, there are many restaurants right around the corner. Breakfast, lunch or dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristin_in_boston
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in the Rick Steves guidebook to Italy. It was easy to get to - just a short, scenic boat ride to the San Samuele stop. My boyfriend and I had been upgraded to a room with a private bathroom (we had just reserved a double with shared bathroom), and our room was large and had a nice window with a small balcony overlooking the street. Furnishings were dated but fine. Our friends however were not upgraded and had a VERY small room full of IKEA furniture - barely any room to walk around the double bed. The price is very reasonable for Venice, and the location was perfect; short walk to PIazza San Marco, Rialto, Accademia, just about anywhere. Overall a decent hotel but be aware that there is a HUGE variation in the quality of rooms. No breakfast included but they offer a breakfast (I think for five euros) at a hotel nearby. Didn't try that so can't comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal basis”
Reviews.Author: Ylang-x2
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with helpful staff, in the centre of Vanice at just 5 minutes walk from San Marco. Easy to reach from the airport with a boat ride of one hour (Alilaguna line to San Angelo). An ideal basis to explore Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a sightseeing base.”
Reviews.Author: VixNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Absolutely charming hotel. Excellent location and great value for money. Rooms simple but clean and comfortable. Staff very friendsly. Didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Good for young travelers”
Reviews.Author: Caladonia
Reviews.Content: Myself, my boyfriend, and a close friend all traveled to Venice this last holiday season for a week. We stay in the San Samuele for 6 nights.I can not remember the room we stayed in but it had two twins and a king. Not the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in but I still highly recommend this place for young people traveling. It is nothing fancy. But it is clean and cheap and the staff was nice. The best part was our very last night they did not have a place for us at their hostel but sense we had been with them for so many nights they upgraded us into an apartment close by that was being rented out by their sister hotel for the same price as our room. All together i really enjoyed my experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cheap”
Reviews.Author: funtnt
Reviews.Content: I only need a place to stay for 2 nights in Venice, found this little hotel, extremely convenient to get around, a great price for what you get in Venice, considering all the other places charged at least double. With shared bathroom, a single bed, small window, sink and breakfast. Friendly staff, shared bathroom, can be hot/noisy but nothing terrible. If I need a place to stay again for a few nights I would consider to return. Paid less than 35 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Venice lodging”
Reviews.Author: Italophile
Reviews.Content: San Samuele was easy to find and in a good location (convenient to San Marco and Rialto area without being in the midst of it). We checked in with ease for two nights. The first night, a man there told us there was a mistake and that we were in the wrong room. He wanted us to move--even though we were dressed for bed. Apparently the person who checked us in, made the mistake. My husband, who speaks Italian, finally convinced the hotel man to let us sleep in the room we were already in and then move to the other room the next day. The first room we were in was very small. Not a true 'matrimoniale' sized bed. More like a small American full size. There was a sink, small table, closet, small window. No bedside lamps or tables and barely room to walk around the perimeter of the bed (and the room). I think it is better suited for a single person or an adult with one child. The second room we were moved to was much better. It had 2 windows, true matrimoniale size bed, two night stands with lamps, sink, closet, small table desk w/chair. We did not opt for their breakfast so can't comment on it. The bath in the hall was fine. The shower seemed to work ok with enough warm water. The room and bath were clean. The staff were helpful when we had questions. Given that Venezia is so expensive, this was a good value compared to others I looked at online. Compared to other hotels in Italy, it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeJog
Reviews.Content: The location is great close to the main square but not to close, room was simple but clean and tidy. For Venice good value as well. I would not bother with the breakfast in there sister hotel there is a cafe just a few doors down which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Basic in good location- but loud and hot”
Reviews.Author: Anna801
Reviews.Content: This was a pensione with the very basics, but at a decent price in a good location. We weren't expecting anything fancy like A/C, but a small fan would have been nice. We had to keep the windows open to get any air circulation and the restaurant just next to the hotel stays busy and loud until 1 am. Then the pigeons wake you in the morning. There were also a fair amount of mosquitos and we both received nasty spider bites in our sleep- that may have been because of the open window though.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but clean”
Reviews.Author: tigerllili
Reviews.Content: Lets get the bad out of the way. The front door to the hotel was only closed and locked one night the week I was there and it is very true about the keys anyone could have gone in with no one noticing. The good. It was spotless, a very clean and quiet hotel. It was close to the water bus and not overly crowded touristy area. Most of the staff was vey friendly. My friend was worried about the sharing of the bathroom with 8 rooms, but we never had to wait for it so it wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “the good, basic and cheap option (with a little slip!)”
Reviews.Author: Sinjubju
Reviews.Content: one of the best feature of the hotel is its location - the hotel is just a minute from san samuele water bus station (line 2) or a few minutes from san angelo (line 1), and 10 mins away from the san mark's square. just one little reminder: the hotel's website is a little bit outdated, no.82 bus has been changed to no.2! the room was clean, basic and spacious. they gave us a 3-bed room instead of a double room which we asked for. the room had everything we needed - toilet amneties, towels, a big wardrobe, reading lamps etc. adapters, hairdryers were also available at request. there's just one thing I don't like about the room and that's the lace curtain. prepare to wake up early! the staff were very friendly and most of them speak english. we only met one italian staff who doesn't speak english, but we could still communicate with each other using body language. the slip was the package we purchased (3 nights double room with private bathroom + one hour gondola trip = 400 Euros). When we sent an email to confirm with the time of our gondola trip, the hotel's staff replied just a day before our stay that the gondola was still under maintenance and the trip would not be available. but they were willing to refund 100 euros but we had to look for our own gondolier. we ended up taking a standard gondola ride for 80 euros for 30 mins, which was not bad. overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Basic Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Heather_Lea
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews prior to staying at the hotel. Everyone says to keep your expectations low. I thought the hotel was very comfortable and in a great location close to St. Mark's Square. The beds we stayed in were the softest beds we had the entire trip in Italy. The rooms were basic, no TV, just bed/bathroom but it was a good price and clean so that is all that mattered. The only downside to our stay was that we were 'confirmed' to take a gondolier ride with the lady gondolier advertised on their website. They confirmed our reservation with her and we agreed on a price through a few emails but they could not confirm the exact time and we were told to ask when we check-in. When we arrived, I asked and was told that she hadn't got started yet and was unsure why we weren't told that. I showed them my emails from them (2 different people) and there wasn't much of an explanation. One thing that was strange is that you have to turn in your keys before leaving, even if you are just going to dinner. This would be okay if it were in a secure location but it's right as you turn the corner into the receptionist's area. The receptionist has 2 rooms and sits behind a wall in the other room. So you hang up your own key in the first room, and pick it up...yourself. I didn't feel 100% comfortable with this and one night we quickly went to find something to eat and I decided to not walk up stairs to turn the key in. When we got back, the receptionist guy confronted us and told me that we need to do this. I viewed this as a good thing because it did seem as if they were paying close attention to who was coming in and out. Overall, it was a nice, basic hotel and we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, very basic”
Reviews.Author: intotrash
Reviews.Content: Our stay at San Samuele was nice, and just what we needed it to be -- a basic clean, room for a GREAT price. We were in a double w/ bath but it was nowhere near as nice the one in the picture w/ the tiled bath! That was my only issue, I had hoped for a more spacious or attractive room (and in my reservation had asked for a nicer room) based on some nicer rooms I've seen on tripadvisor but ours was very very basic. Still, it was perfectly clean and a good value and we spent very little time in the room anyway! To us the walls weren't so thin, but street noise was an issue. I travel with earplugs and it was no problem for me but my boyfriend was kept up a few nights. We weren't big fans of the key system either, please note -- we had NO issues with security, but you leave your key in a front room and there is no supervision of these keys so it just felt a little unsecured -- suggestion to management -- just move the keys back into the room where you sit! Another plus was that the staff was very friendly and the location was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely helpful people and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: mermaid_cat
Reviews.Content: It is quite hidden away but not hard to find as there is a ferry (traghetto) stop right next to it, helpfully called San Samuele. Basic rooms but clean and with everything you need. The reception guys were very friendly and helpful, always smiling and made us feel very welcome. Only down side was the paper thin walls which could be an issue if hotel was full but as me and my friend were there in January, it was pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, quiet place to rest and rejuvenate”
Reviews.Author: MikeDana2
Reviews.Content: This wonderful find in a quiet, residential neighborhood was a gem to find. My husband and I had a nice, quiet room that was clean and well-kept. The staff was friendly and helpful, The hotel was conveniently located very near to 2 vaporetti stops and walking distance to San Marco and Rialto, as well as most of Venice! The best part was during the acqua alta, the hotel provided us with boots which allowed us to explore the city even during high tide! We would stay here again in a heartbeat and will recommend it to all our friends! Salut!

Reviews.Title: “Alex the gondolier was the best part!”
Reviews.Author: Spinyray
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 5 adults and the family suite was great. Alex took us out for a gondola tour at night . It was spectacular! Nice and clean, helpful and friendly, plus close to everything. Would definitely stay there again! Bryan in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “a venetian gem”
Reviews.Author: psaltyne
Reviews.Content: I'm a young, solo traveller. I normally stay in hostels. However, since Venice's hostels aren't on the main island, I decided to go for a hostel. After a quite depressing search for a place to stay, I was thrilled to come across San Samuele (found it in my guidebook, and all the trip advisor reviews that i read were very pleasant). I was offered a single for 3 nights (during the week) for 59 euro a night. A pleasant surprise at arrival: you get a 5% discount if you pay in cash. No problem! I TRIED to find a bad review on the internet - and i couldn't. Every other place I looked at in venice was at least 80, if not 95 for a single. No breakfast is offered at their hotel, however, you can eat for 5 euro at one of their sister hotels, which are very close to San Samuele. 5 euros was not bad - for the chance to actually SIT DOWN while eating in venice and not feel rushed (cereal, fresh rolls, croissants, etc). My "single" was actually a double bed, and the room size was fine. It's very basic - but with a sink in the room, which was a nice touch. The bathroom was shared - but it was always available, always CLEAN, and they also provide some soap and shower gel and GREAT towels (been to similar places that have sandpaper for towels). The staff was always friendly (both at San Samuel and at Art Deco, where I ate breakfast). Samol speaks excellent English, and was always pleasant! The hotel is very easy to find, and is just a 3 min walk from the San Samuele Vaporetto stop, which is great, as when you arrive in Venice, you dont have your bearings, and it can be difficult to get around if you've not brought a good map). I will definitely stay at San Samuele if/when I return to Venice, and I will encourage any of my friends to stay there too!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and quiet”
Reviews.Author: WanderingK
Reviews.Content: Venice is expensive, but this is a great little place very close to the San Samuele vaporetto stop. I had a single room with the shared bathroom. Both were very clean and I never had to wait for the bathroom. Good place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at this incredible location”
Reviews.Author: MrsTaco
Reviews.Content: After contacting what seemed like a hundred hotels, which were all sold out, my husband and I found this property and booked three nights in late May. As we were traveling for several weeks, we were trying to keep our accomodations budget down, and the prices here are incredibly reasonable considering what a great location this property has - walking distance to basically everywhere in venice, right next to a traghetto and vaporetto stop, but far enough from the tourist circus to feel authentic and charming. Our room was on the top floor and was quite small, adequate but somewhat shabby, and we had the shared bath. In three days we were never able to shower on our floor, we always had to go downstairs to find an available bathroom, and there was always someone waiting for the shower after us, so the shared baths can get a bit crowded. Despite that, the bathrooms were very clean. It was really warm the week we visited, but the hotel gave us a fan, which was fine. No breakfast, but that was fine as well - we tried the breakfast at the sister hotel one day and it was not very good - cappuccino at a cafe was much better. This is definitely a great find for a budget traveler that wants to stay in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KMPBuffalo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Italy! As we were backpacking through Italy for 2 weeks, our main concerns with booking accomodations were (1) Location (2) Price. Albergo San Samuele far surpassed our expectations of both of these criteria. This hotel is located in such a charming nightlife... a quick walk to St. Mark's... an even quicker walk to Academia & Dorsoduro (a great area to enjoy a late meal, gelatto, and night stroll). The room was small, but very clean. Again on a budget, we opted to share the bathroom, which was very clean and always available. This is a great choice for the budget traveler, who really wants to be in the heart of Venice. Krista, Buffalo, New York

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: LindaRas
Reviews.Content: I have never used a one-star hotel before, but my traveling companions were on a stricter budget than I, so I accepted the challenge of finding an acceptable one-star hotel. I tried all the convent hotels that were in good locations, and when I learned all were full (the Bienniale di Venetia was going on while we were there it turned out), I started looking at regular hotels. A couple guide books had good things to say about Albergo San Samuele, so I took a chance on it. I would have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The location was perfect: walking distance to San Marco, Rialto and Accademia, as well as vaporetto and traghetto stops, but far enough away from these tourist honeypots to feel like a neighborhood. There are several decent trattorias within a couple blocks (walking toward the nearest large campo), and several bars on the campo from which to relax with a cold drink at an outdoor table and observe the nightly passeggiata. There were also interesting galleries and antique stores, and if one wanted to get picnic food, at least one small grocery store close by. The Italian staff at the hotel were quite pleasant. One spoke English quite well, another didn't speak it at all. I speak Italian, so that wasn't a problem. The room was small, but very clean and pleasant. The bed was very comfortable. I would have liked somewhere to sit and read at night as the tiny lamps next to the bed were no good for reading. Next time, I would bring a little book light. My room was on the front of the hotel, and there was some street noise (people talking and the clatter of dishes from the trattoria down the street), especially on the weekend, but I found that closing both shutters and interior windows helped a lot. It eventually got quiet when the trattoria closed around midnight. We were there in the first half of June, and it was hotter and more humid than I was expecting, so I was greatly relieved to find that the room was equipped with a nice fan that kept me comfortable during the night. (I'm not sure it would be enough for July and August, however.) It also came in handy for drying my hand wash. I feel I should warn that the lack of elevator could be a problem for those with physical limitations. My room was on the first floor (i.e. one floor up), but that required ascending 38 steps just to get to that floor, and I was plenty tired and winded when I finally got there. That is also the floor where the reception desk is located, so that is the minimum number of steps quests must ascend. The second floor is another good climb. On balance, I found this to be a pleasant hotel: clean, comfortable, excellent location, and very good value. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nights at paradise”
Reviews.Author: JavierAguilarMexico
Reviews.Content: Clean and small hotel in the most beatifull city in the world, near to San Marco, extremely kind people working there...a place to stay...and cheap, for Venice

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2007, and were very pleasantly surprised. We expected it to be hard to find, but it was so simple, even at 10:00 at night. The room we got (M1) on the third floor was huge! For 2 people, we had a queen and 2 single beds. 2 big windows with shutters that open onto a quiet street. Antique Armoirs and vanity. No bathroom or sink in the room, but just down the hall were 2 huge bathrooms which we seemed to have all to ourselves, as we never ran into anyone else using them. Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer. We got engaged in Venice on this trip, so this hotel will remain special in my mind for a long time to come. The 2 men that we saw at the front desk were delightfully Italian.. if I had an Italian Grandpa, either of these men would be my first pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Focus_girl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned on a 9-day trip to Italy. This was our last stop. We considered this hotel to be quite a find in a really expensive city since we were on a budget. Keep your expectations about the room realistic. While we found the beds to be very comfortable, the rooms are basic and the showers are small. But we did not go to Venice to hang out in our hotel. Keep in mind that hotels on the Grand Canal are around 300 Euro a night! This hotel is located in San Marco and is in a great location to see all of Venice. There are two vaporetto stops (Line 1 and 81) nearby making it easy to get around the city. Consider getting the multi-day pass. There was bacari down the street from the hotel to enjoy cicchetti. It's a great place to get a glass of wine and snacks. From what I understand, you need to look for these places, so it was quite lucky to find one so close. Try the grilled cuttlefish! I would recommend this place to anyone who want to visit Venice on a budget but still wants to stay in the middle of the city.

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo San Samuele
HotelInfo.Address: Salizzada San Samuele, 30124 Venice, Italy
